plugin_desc: The host monitoring plugin is used to collect and analyze performance data of hosts, including CPU, memory, disk, and network usage.
name: Host

metrics.name: cpu_usage_total
metrics.description: Reflects the overall CPU utilization of the host, representing the proportion of non-idle CPU time. Sustained high values usually indicate CPU resource pressure or bottlenecks.

metrics.name: cpu_usage_core
metrics.description: Describes the utilization of individual CPU cores, enabling analysis of load distribution and identification of imbalanced or hot cores.

metrics.name: cpu_usage_iowait_total
metrics.description: Indicates the proportion of CPU time spent waiting for I/O operations to complete, commonly used to identify disk or I/O performance constraints.

metrics.name: cpu_usage_system_total
metrics.description: Represents the percentage of CPU time spent executing kernel-level tasks. Abnormally high values may indicate increased system overhead or frequent system calls.

metrics.name: cpu_usage_user_total
metrics.description: Indicates the percentage of CPU time spent executing user-space application logic, commonly used to evaluate application CPU consumption.

metrics.name: cpu_usage_irq_total
metrics.description: Represents the percentage of CPU time spent handling hardware interrupts, helpful for diagnosing hardware or driver-related performance issues.

metrics.name: cpu_usage_steal_total
metrics.description: Indicates the proportion of CPU time stolen by the hypervisor in virtualized environments, used to assess CPU contention.

metrics.name: system_load1
metrics.description: Represents the average system load over the last 1 minute, primarily used to observe short-term load fluctuations.

metrics.name: system_load5
metrics.description: Represents the average system load over the last 5 minutes, useful for analyzing short-term load trends.

metrics.name: system_load15
metrics.description: Represents the average system load over the last 15 minutes, commonly used to evaluate long-term load stability.

metrics.name: diskio_io_util
metrics.description: Indicates the proportion of time a disk device is busy handling I/O operations. Sustained high values usually suggest disk I/O saturation.

metrics.name: diskio_writes_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of disk write operations completed per second, measuring write I/O intensity and concurrency.

metrics.name: diskio_write_bytes_rate
metrics.description: Indicates the amount of data written to disk per unit time, used to evaluate disk write throughput.

metrics.name: disk_write_latency
metrics.description: Represents the average latency of disk write operations, used to analyze disk write performance and responsiveness.

metrics.name: diskio_reads_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of disk read operations completed per second, measuring read I/O concurrency and intensity.

metrics.name: diskio_read_bytes_rate
metrics.description: Indicates the amount of data read from disk per unit time, used to evaluate disk read throughput.

metrics.name: disk_read_latency
metrics.description: Represents the average latency of disk read operations, used to analyze disk read performance and access delay.

metrics.name: disk_total
metrics.description: Represents the total capacity of a disk or filesystem, used for capacity planning and resource management.

metrics.name: disk_free
metrics.description: Represents the currently available free space of a disk or filesystem, used to monitor capacity risks.

metrics.name: disk_used_percent
metrics.description: Represents the percentage of disk space that has been consumed, a core metric for disk capacity monitoring.

metrics.name: disk_inodes_used_percent
metrics.description: Represents the percentage of inode usage in a filesystem, helping prevent failures caused by inode exhaustion.

metrics.name: processes_running
metrics.description: Represents the number of processes currently in a running state, reflecting system concurrency.

metrics.name: processes_blocked
metrics.description: Represents the number of processes blocked due to I/O or resource contention, helping identify system bottlenecks.

metrics.name: processes_zombies
metrics.description: Represents the number of zombie processes that have exited but remain unreaped, potentially indicating process management issues.

metrics.name: processes_sleeping
metrics.description: Represents the number of processes currently in a sleeping or waiting state.

metrics.name: mem_total
metrics.description: Represents the total amount of physical memory available on the system, serving as a baseline for memory evaluation.

metrics.name: mem_available
metrics.description: Represents the amount of memory available for applications without causing significant performance degradation.

metrics.name: mem_used_percent
metrics.description: Represents the percentage of memory currently in use, indicating overall memory pressure.

metrics.name: mem_swap_free
metrics.description: Represents the amount of free swap space available, used to monitor buffering capacity under memory pressure.

metrics.name: mem_cached
metrics.description: Represents the amount of memory used for file caching, which can be reclaimed when necessary.

metrics.name: mem_shared
metrics.description: Represents the amount of memory shared among multiple processes.

metrics.name: mem_buffered
metrics.description: Represents the amount of memory used for buffering block device I/O operations.

metrics.name: net_packets_recv_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of packets received per unit time on a network interface, reflecting packet-level traffic.

metrics.name: net_packets_sent_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of packets sent per unit time on a network interface.

metrics.name: net_bytes_recv_rate
metrics.description: Represents the amount of data received per unit time on a network interface, used to evaluate inbound bandwidth utilization.

metrics.name: net_bytes_sent_rate
metrics.description: Represents the amount of data sent per unit time on a network interface, used to evaluate outbound bandwidth utilization.

metrics.name: net_err_in_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of errored packets received per unit time, used to monitor network quality.

metrics.name: net_err_out_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of errored packets sent per unit time on a network interface.

metrics.name: net_drop_in_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of incoming packets dropped per unit time, indicating congestion or abnormal conditions.

metrics.name: net_drop_out_rate
metrics.description: Represents the number of outgoing packets dropped per unit time on a network interface.

metrics.name: nvidia_smi_memory_total
metrics.description: Represents the total available memory capacity of the GPU, serving as a baseline GPU resource metric.

metrics.name: nvidia_smi_memory_free
metrics.description: Represents the amount of free GPU memory currently available for allocation.

metrics.name: nvidia_smi_utilization_memory
metrics.description: Represents the percentage of GPU memory currently in use, indicating GPU memory pressure.

metrics.name: nvidia_smi_power_draw
metrics.description: Represents the current power consumption of the GPU, used to monitor energy usage and operating status.

metrics.name: nvidia_smi_temperature_gpu
metrics.description: Represents the current core temperature of the GPU, used to monitor thermal conditions and cooling health.

metrics.name: nvidia_smi_fan_speed_avg
metrics.description: Represents the average GPU fan speed as a percentage, used to assess cooling behavior and hardware status.
